page.title: 08CHURCH ATTENDANCE IN BRECHIN
page.content: {The Cathedral,}being the largest church, holds memberships from people in all parts of the town and surrounding rural areas. Two services, of about one hour duration, are held each Sunday morning and evening.There are{1340}people on the roll and the 1984 census showed that 900 attended communion that year. Total membership has fallen by almost 600 since 1960 due to changing attitudes towards religion.{90}pupils are enrolled in the{Sunday School.} This is a decline of almost 50% since 1960. During weekdays the Cathedral offers facilities for other clubs and organisations who wish to be connected with the church. These include Girl Guides and Brownies, Women's Guild, a Young wives' group, a badminton club,a Bible Class and a Choir.
